p: Fourteen percent ( n = 10) of animals were estimated to be <1 year old, 23% ( n = 16) were between 1 and 3 years old, 36% ( n = 25) were aged 3–6 years, and 27% ( n = 19) were estimated to be >6 years old. All samples were found negative by RT-PCR and ELISA, in all age groups, indicating no evidence of current, recent, or past RVF infections in our study animals [seroprevalence p = 0, 95% confidence interval (0–0.05)]. The estimated lemur population size of Mayotte is about 10–20,000 (Tarnaud 2012), and our study sample, although small, would have allowed to detect an estimated seroprevalence of 15%, with a 10% precision at a 95% confidence level (with a design effect of 1.5).
